steps.title: Open the wikiHow search bar.
steps.content: Open the wikiHow search bar. This opens when you click above the white line (between wikiHow and the magnifying glass) in the green bar overhead.

steps.title: Type your query using keywords.
steps.content: Type your query using keywords. Use the main words which you think will be likely to give results containing answers to your question.

steps.title: Hit the ↵ Enter button of your keyboard to view a list of titles.
steps.content: Hit the ↵ Enter button of your keyboard to view a list of titles. Alternatively, you can click on the magnifying glass once you have typed your query.

steps.title: Click on Categories at the upper left of any page.
steps.content: Click on Categories at the upper left of any page.

steps.title: Click on the most appropriate general category.
steps.content: Click on the most appropriate general category.

steps.title: Click on the most appropriate sub-category (optional).
steps.content: Click on the most appropriate sub-category (optional). Featured articles appear at the top of a page. Articles that require further editing appear at the bottom of a page.

steps.title: Click on related wikiHow articles.
steps.content: Click on related wikiHow articles. These can be found at the bottom of each article, or in the column to the right.

steps.title: Click on any highlighted text.
steps.content: Click on any highlighted text. It will give more detailed information.

steps.title: Navigate to your favorite or default search engine.
steps.content: Navigate to your favorite or default search engine.

steps.title: Type "www.wikihow.com" (excluding quotes) into the search bar.
steps.content: Type "www.wikihow.com" (excluding quotes) into the search bar.

steps.title: Space once after "www.wikihow.com".
steps.content: Space once after "www.wikihow.com". Type in your desired search terms.

steps.title: Go to www.wikihow.com/Special:Search.
steps.content: Go to www.wikihow.com/Special:Search . Note: This tool is only available to registered users and searches all pages, hidden or not hidden.

steps.title: Click on the red link, if an article does not exist.
steps.content: Click on the red link, if an article does not exist. If it does exist, you will see it as the top search result. If an article exists under a different name, you may want to create a redirect. Simply type in #REDIRECT [[Target page]] .
